EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Purpose: To process raw materials via a network of stone furnaces and supporting inserters and chests.  
  Consists of:  
  – Stone furnaces at positions (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0)  
  – Burner inserters placed around positions such as (2.5, –0.5), (1.5, 0.5) and (3.5, 0.5)  
  – Wooden chests acting as buffers at positions (0.5, 2.5), (1.5, 1.5) and (2.5, 0.5)  
  – Transport belts interconnecting these units for smooth material flow

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Purpose: To extract iron ore and initiate its conveyance toward processing zones.  
  Consists of:  
  – A burner mining drill positioned at (–15.0, –50.0)  
  – An adjacent wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5) for temporary storage  
  – Burner inserters deployed at positions (–14.5, –52.5), (–13.5, –52.5), (–16.5, –48.5), (–14.5, –47.5) and (–13.5, –47.5)  
  – Transport belts that route extracted ore between entities

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Purpose: To convert fuel and water into usable electrical power for production.  
  Consists of:  
  – A boiler located at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5), and a steam output at (6.5, 20.5)  
  – Steam engines (generators) placed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5)  
  – An extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to spatial congestion and overlapping adjacent entities

• Automation Research Lab  
  Purpose: To conduct technological research by processing science packs.  
  Consists of:  
  – Laboratory units (noted with input requirements such as {automation‑science‑pack: 20}) that are experiencing intermittent power connectivity, as indicated by associated electrical IDs

• Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
  Purpose: To secure a reliable water source for fluid‑dependent processes.  
  Consists of:  
  – An offshore pump located at (0.5, 30.5)  
  – Associated PipeGroups that distribute water across the map

• Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
  Purpose: To maintain the backbone of power distribution and material/logistics flow.  
  Consists of:  
  – Multiple ElectricityGroups managing power pole networks  
  – Various BeltGroups forming interconnected transport routes  
  – Several PipeGroups establishing distinct fluid routing systems

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – Spatial congestion in the boiler zone hinders the installation of an extra steam engine despite its availability in inventory.  
  – Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts—especially around the boiler at (8.0, 20.5) and the connection point at (8.5, 22.5)—create an obstructed build space.  
  – Recommendations:  
    • Reevaluate the boiler zone; remove or reposition conflicting entities such as burner‑inserters and transport belts.  
    • Adjust adjacent connection interfaces to free up sufficient placement space.  
    • Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or redesigning the boiler layout to resolve the bottleneck.
